beliefs: All druids look after the natural world, but do it in different ways.
Ashbound: The champions of the natural world. We defend it from anything and anyone who threatens it.
Children of Winter: Preserve the natural cycle of life and death. Disease and decay cull the weak and strengthen the whole. We must destroy undead and ensure that the cycle continues.
Gatekeepers: Protect the natural world from the forces that come from outside it, from those beings that slither in from the darkness beyond.
Greensingers: Celebrate the magic in the natural world, as well as the fey that embody that magic. We serve as ambassadors between the fey and mortals, protecting each from the other.

Wardens of the Wood: Protect all the children of Eberron, from the beasts of the wild to the people of the cities. We preserve the balance between nature and civilization and help each understand the other.
followers: Mostly orcs and half-orcs, but anyone can become a druid

deities.name: Nature/Fey (Any good alignment)
deities.desc: Druids serve Eberron and try and preserve nature. Worship and practices vary depending on one's sect

practices: Ashbound: Defend the natural world from anything that threatens it. Some Ashbound consider civilization to be a threat and strike at any settlement that encroaches on the wild. Others focus their wrath on the dragonmarked houses or seek to free bound elementals.

The Children of Winter: Believe that death and decay are vital aspects of the natural cycle of life. They believe that if the cycle falls out of balance, it will trigger a devastating cataclysm as the world resets this balance. They battle undead, but they also engage in actions that cull the weak. Extremists have been known to spread plagues in cities. The Children of Winter are particularly interested in unraveling the mystery of the Mourning, as some of them believe it is a sign of the apocalypse they fear.

The Gatekeepers: One of the oldest sects, primarily found among the orcs of the Shadow Marches. They act to protect Eberron from aberrations and other unnatural creatures and seek to prevent extraplanar incursions and attacks. The Gatekeepers maintain ancient seals that hold long-forgotten evils at bay.

The Greensingers: Devoted to the fey, and serve as mediators between the fey and mortals. The ranks of the Greensingers include bards as well as warlocks with Archfey patrons; a druid or ranger might also serve a specific archfey.

The Wardens of the Wood: Believe that civilization has a place in the world. As a warden, you help others understand nature, ensuring that they donâ€™t cause unintentional harm or stumble into danger. Wardens serve as militia and mediators in the Eldeen Reaches. This is the largest of the druidic sects and the most recognized.
